variables.name: Frequency factor
variables.description: Pre-exponential frequency factor in the Arrhenius equation for reaction i

variables.name: Reaction rate constant
variables.description: Rate constant for reaction i in the transesterification process

variables.name: Universal gas constant
variables.description: Universal gas constant relating energy and temperature

variables.name: Concentration of component
variables.description: Concentration of component i in the reactor

variables.name: Triglyceride concentration
variables.description: Concentration of triglycerides in the reactor

variables.name: Diglyceride concentration
variables.description: Concentration of diglycerides in the reactor

variables.name: Monoglyceride concentration
variables.description: Concentration of monoglycerides in the reactor

variables.name: Methyl ester concentration
variables.description: Concentration of methyl ester (biodiesel) in the reactor

variables.name: Methanol concentration
variables.description: Concentration of methanol in the reactor

variables.name: Glycerol concentration
variables.description: Concentration of glycerol in the reactor

variables.name: Right-hand side function
variables.description: Right-hand side of the ordinary differential equation for component i

variables.name: Hamiltonian
variables.description: Hamiltonian function combining state and adjoint variables in the optimal control formulation

variables.name: Temperature
variables.description: Reaction temperature, used as the control variable

variables.name: Adjoint variable
variables.description: Adjoint (co-state) variable associated with component i in the optimal control problem

variables.name: Activation energy ratio
variables.description: Ratio of activation energy to the gas constant (E_a_i/R) for reaction i

variables.name: Objective function
variables.description: Performance index representing a weighted sum of component concentrations at final time

variables.name: Objective weight constant
variables.description: Constant weight for component i in the linear objective function
